 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַפִּיר‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==sapphire==, perhaps also ==lapis lazuli== (compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Exod.24.10|Exod 24:10]]</sup> [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archaeology i. 131</sup>) (Late Hebrew ***id.***, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַמְפִּירִינוֺן‎</span>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַפִּרִינוֺן‎</span>; [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; loan-word from Sanskrit <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***canipriya***</u></abbr> according to [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>Ges. Abh. 72</sup> [[BDB#Lewy|Lewy]]<sup>Fremdw. 56</sup> compare Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">σάπφειρος</span>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[Exod.24.10|Exod 24:10]] + 8 t.; plural<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַפִּירִים‎</span> [[Isa.54.11|Isa 54:11]]; [[Song.5.14|Song 5:14]] — with other jewels as ornaments of prince [[Ezek.28.13|Ezek 28:13]] in high priest's breastplate [[Exod.28.18|Exod 28:18]]; [[Exod.39.11|Exod 39:11]] found in mines [[Job.28.6|Job 28:6]], costly [[Job.28.16|Job 28:16]] compare [[Isa.54.11|Isa 54:11]] taking high polish [[Lam.4.7|Lam 4:7]] (in figurative); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁן מְעֻלֶּפֶת סַפִּירִים‎</span> [[Song.5.14|Song 5:14]] ***ivory covered with sapphires*** (in figurative); ***lapis lazuli***, according to [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] BU [[BDB#Du|Du]] and others in [[Job.28.6|Job 28:6]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַפְרֹת זָהָב לוֺ‎</span> being understood of sparkling crystals of iron pyrites in this), but see [[BDB#Di|Di]]; ***lapis lazuli*** may be intended in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִבְנַת הַסּ‎</span> [[Exod.24.10|Exod 24:10]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) ***pavement of sapphire*** (in theoph.), compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶבֶןסֿ‎</span> [[Ezek.1.26|Ezek 1:26]]; [[Ezek.10.1|Ezek 10:1]].
